title: The Jamestown story
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns - United States
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Management - Study and teaching
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Industrial relations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Labor and laboring classes - United States
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/United States - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Labor disputes
description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.
